headline: After Tanning SOS: Yogurt And Other Ways To Undo Sun Damage This Weekend
short descr: We live for summer weekends outside the city. Whether we head upstate to the country or out to the beach, nothing beats a
image_caption(s): Clarisonic Mia 2 Sonic Skin Cleansing System In Tangerine, $150
article: We live for summer weekends outside the city. Whether we head upstate to the country or out to the beach, nothing beats a few days of recharging and getting some sun. But returning Sunday nights, your hair, face and feet can look (and feel) a little worse for wear. Even though we're sure you're wearing  sunscreen, the sun can still wreak havoc, making everything desperately dry and a little weathered. We're all well-versed in what to pack when you're getting away, but what about all the catch-up work when you get back? We've found the best products that'll leave you looking glowy, well-rested and back in top form by the time Monday rolls around. Want more? Be sure to check out Stylelist on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr and Pinterest.

headline: Wedding Gifts That Are So Cool, You'll Never Find Them On A Registry (PHOTOS)
short descr: Weddings are a fabulous time for the bride and groom (planning headaches aside). But for the guests? Well, that's debatable
image_caption(s): What better way to de-stress after all that wedding planning?
article: Weddings are a fabulous time for the bride and groom (planning headaches aside). But for the guests? Well, that's debatable. We are fraught with details like where to stay, what to wear and what to give the celebrated duo. Though, the argument in my brain usually sounds something like this: Is the vase too cheap? But we already spent so much on the tickets to get here!By the time I actually purchase a wedding gift, the pair has already celebrated their first anniversary, but that is beside the point. My major problem is that when I check their registry online (What is her maiden name? How am I supposed to know?) all the relatively inexpensive stuff has been purchased, and I am left with crystal candlesticks that cost about as much as a mortgage payment. So, rather than put yet another expense on my overextended credit card, I take another route: Gifts that weren't on the registry. Risky? Maybe. But if they don't like it, they can always return it. We've rounded up 12 wedding gift options that are worthy of earning you the title of "Best Guest Ever."Want more? Be sure to check out Stylelist on Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr and Pinterest.
